intro: Periblema cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed periblema, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with tubular corollas and distinctive, sharp-pointed leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical or subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Periblema cuspidata is considered a species of conservation concern.
